content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with a potential tenant named Haoyu Wang from China.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for an apartment in Duisburg.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why didn't you agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: The negotiation did not result in an agreement due to the lack of information about the apartment and the persistence of the potential tenant in offering lower prices. I was seeking the highest price possible for the apartment, but the tenant continued to offer lower prices, despite my requests to stick to the rental price.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner at 7. The potential tenant was respectful and responsive to the negotiation process, but the lack of understanding of the negotiation rules led to some unnecessary back and forth.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I did not feel discriminated or offended. The potential tenant's conduct was respectful and professional, despite the misunderstanding about the negotiation rules.
name: Peter Schmidt
